div.p: God be with you! The long letter that Tschudi wrote in your country is nothing other than that Mendoza, about whom I last wrote to you, who gladly rode and traveled from France to Bern, Lucerne, Zurich, and elsewhere, also acted according to his name. There may be some truth in it; but much is evidently not so, etc.
As for Turry, I cannot tell you anything other than what I have read; it is a small town between Macon and Chalon. The French names are sometimes not written correctly; I do the same here.

Siderhar has not come in these eight days (except that Calvin writes to me that the English have come 4000 strong into Normandy, causing great fear to the enemy; whether it is so, I do not know). I cannot write more at this time. God be with you.
Requesting for me about session 2, 3, 4; you could do nothing more pleasant for me. August 28, 62.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, minister of the church of Chur, most esteemed and dear friend and brother. Chur.
